stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on polishing the factory / bomb-cap stage: squashing visual bugs, re-adding effects to the re-modeled King Bob-omb, and coordinating missing textures with Biobak while chatting about release plans and personal topics.

development_findings.summary: Textures for factorycanon.blend are missing; Kaze pings Biobak to supply them.
development_findings.quote: "Biobak, there's textures missing in the factorycanon.blend file."

development_findings.summary: Looping alarm SFX will be attached to moving cannons and positioned dynamically in-game.
A gear in the factory rotated on the wrong axis; Kaze corrected the axis math.
King Bob-omb re-model lost its hit-flash; Kaze restores the orange primitive-color flash and sets the boss to die in one hit and despawn permanently once the Bomb Cap is unlocked.
development_findings.quote: "I can restore the effect... and then I need to make him die in one hit."

development_findings.summary: Added a wall that rises when a switch is pressed; player must break it later with bombs, changing room flow.
development_findings.quote: "The wall comes up as soon as you press the switch… in the end you're just gonna have to break the wall."

development_findings.summary: Stage is designed to be completed both forward and backward for variant challenge; Kaze tested the reverse route and likes the feel.
development_findings.quote: "I did beat it backwards earlier and I think it's really fun."

development_findings.summary: Cap switches currently use the wrong red texture; flagged for later fix.
Bomb Cap power-up lets Mario spawn bombs; physics stay mostly Mario 64-standard.
development_findings.quote: "There is a Bomb Cap that you can use to spawn bombs."

development_findings.summary: While waiting for Biobak’s reworks Kaze plans a polish pass adding VFX/SFX and higher visual fidelity.
development_findings.quote: "Likely what I’ll do in that time is improve the visual fidelity of things."

development_findings.summary: Shader idea: grayscale texture * shade color * primitive color lets one material inherit room-based lighting cheaply.
development_findings.quote: "We get a quadruple multiplication… primitive color can be the lighting in the room."

development_findings.summary: Public demo content is functionally finished; release tied to production of three promo videos.
development_findings.quote: "The new demo will be released whenever the video for it is ready… might be December 28th."

context_findings.summary: Kaze states he is 29, doesn’t keep a phone plan, and rarely goes outside.
context_findings.quote: "I don’t go outside – what do I need a phone for?"

context_findings.summary: He jokes about his ‘infinite ego’ and is unfazed by being called dumb.
context_findings.quote: "One of the benefits of having literally infinite ego."

context_findings.summary: Took an online autism test on-stream; concludes he isn’t autistic but acknowledges overlapping traits.
context_findings.quote: "I am not autistic at all except in social relatedness."

context_findings.summary: Discusses Twitter Blue monetization and a potential Manscaped sponsorship email.
context_findings.quote: "Shaving my balls live on video for $2,000 – I can respond yes, I’m interested."

context_findings.summary: Stream ends early due to off-stream commitments, hinting at time-management balancing.

biobak.summary: Tasked with supplying missing factory textures and clarifying which level to tackle next.
biobak.quote: "Biobak… do you know which level you want to do next? This is going to affect my decisions."

biobak.summary: Working on large-scale stage reworks; wall gears and bombable wall art pending.

key_stories.title: Re-animating King Bob-omb
key_stories.summary: During the stream Kaze discovered the new King Bob-omb model no longer flashed when damaged. He investigated the display list, identified the missing primitive-color command, restored an orange flash, and balanced the fight to a single hit that permanently removes the boss once the Bomb Cap is earned.
key_stories.challenge: Visual damage feedback was lost after model rebuild.
key_stories.process: Traced material commands, reinstated primitive-color change, adjusted HP variable.
key_stories.outcome: Effect restored; boss now dies in one hit and won’t respawn if the player already has the Bomb Cap.
key_stories.key_quote: "I can change it to 1, but I don’t want to lose the effect."

key_stories.title: Demo Release Bottleneck
key_stories.summary: Although gameplay for the next public demo is finished, Kaze is holding release until three promotional videos are produced—one by himself, one by his editor, and a December 14th Missing Link retrospective.
key_stories.challenge: Need marketing materials before public demo drop.
key_stories.process: Scheduled personal video for Saturday, awaiting editor, planning final video mid-December.
key_stories.outcome: Tentative demo release window around December 28th.
key_stories.key_quote: "I’m basically done with it, but there is one video… then I can release the demo."

open_questions.context: Multiple missing or placeholder textures (factorycanon.blend, wall gears) flagged; Biobak to provide or clarify.
questions: Which specific texture sets are still missing?
Are wall gears being redesigned or removed?
What is the deadline for final art hand-off?

open_questions.context: Cap lets Mario spawn bombs; integration with level puzzles and combat not fully explained.
questions: How does the Bomb Cap alter core gameplay beyond spawning bombs?
Any limits (cooldown, ammo) or unique physics?
How were levels retrofitted to exploit the new mechanic?

open_questions.context: Factory stage is intended to be cleared in both directions, offering distinct experiences.
questions: What specific obstacles change feel between directions?
Any other courses using this philosophy?

open_questions.context: Release is tied to three videos but details of content and goals are vague.
questions: What stories will each video tell?
How do they fit into overall marketing strategy?
Is Nintendo takedown risk considered in timing?

open_questions.context: Kaze expects to finish polish while Biobak completes reworks, but no clear schedule shared.
questions: What is the current milestone schedule for level reworks?
How are responsibilities divided between Kaze and Biobak on polish vs. art?
Are Badub and Zeina on similar timelines?
